reviews.review_msg: Natasha was great in giving great feedbacks to her students, and was a very easy person to approach as she is very passionate and caring person. Th readings are not dense, and quite very long so please be aware of that. The more you get in the class discussion the more your absorb the information. A lot of group discussion which is great!

Best prof i've had so far. Connects and explains course concepts and readings so well. Readings were tough but explained during class. Participation matters, he'll call on you to answer questions. Discussions in class were very insightful. I thought i'd hate the class but it ended up being my fav. Wouldn't suggest it if you don't like anth tho.

Hands down one of my fave professors. Assigns heavy but interesting readings and will call on you so participation matters. But he is judgement free and super chill, will never make you feel stupid. He gives great feedback and wants you to be the best!! He is super approachable as well. Would totally take again :) I hope he stays!
Avoid him if you are not interested in the topic. His classes are not easy.

Elliot is a great and passionate professor that encourages class participation and discussions. Readings are mandatory as he will call on you, but overall its a safe space and an enjoyable class. I definitely recommend him
Great professor and provides amazing feedback, he really cares for your success. The only bad thing is the long and sometimes boring lectures.
Professor does not provide clear instructions for key graded activities. When reaching out the feedback is poor, and fails to answer or clarify the question being asked.

took two in person courses and one online course with this professor, laid back but caring, very knowledgeable and easy to talk with. I had difficulty with my term paper, but a zoom chat with her solved all my concerns.

I thought Jie Yang was an amazing professor. I think what makes her seem inaccessible to some if that she is an incredibly intelligent person. Tough weekly assignment. But, she is a fair grader and an understanding, compassionate person. She has the most calming voice. Generally, the easiest way to go about this course is to listen to her lectures.

Jie was okay. She wasn't really clear on what she wanted from the students at the beginning, and you were only able to figure it out if you saw her in office hours. Even then, I was still unsure of what she wanted. The final exam was terrible. It was basically us having to search through all the readings and group presentations and lecture notes.
